snippet: Monday was moving day in Montreal for 115,000 people who were sticking with a tradition dating to French rule, when all leases were required to begin on the same day.
abstract: Montreal Journal; first day of July, which is federal holiday in Canada, has become unofficial moving day for estimated 115,000 renters in Montreal; mass migration is due to tradition dating to French rule, when all housing leases were required to begin on same day.
lead_paragraph: Monday was moving day in Montreal for 115,000 people who were sticking with a tradition dating to French rule, when all leases were required to begin on the same day.

headline.main: When a City Is on the Move, With Mattresses and Dishwashers in Tow
headline.print_headline: When a City Is on the Move, With Mattresses and Dishwashers in Tow
